adjective.description: (of a waterway or sea) able to be sailed on by ships or boats.
examples: many of the rivers ceased to be navigable

adjective.description: (of a website) easy to move around in.
examples: the use of white space can help make your mobile-optimized site clearer and more navigable

origin: Early 16th century: from French navigable or Latin navigabilis, from the verb navigare to sail (see navigate).
